importantDates.descriptionOfWhyDateIsRelevant: This is the date the article was published, marking the latest update on the food supply situation in Gaza following the ceasefire.

importantTimeframes.descriptionOfWhyTimeFrameIsRelevant: The timeframe indicates the period during which the humanitarian crisis and ceasefire implementation are being monitored, with current developments focused on the immediate aftermath of the US-brokered ceasefire.

keyTakeAways: Food supplies to Gaza remain far below the WFP's daily target of 2,000 tonnes, currently at around 750 metric tonnes per day.
Only two Israeli-controlled crossings—Karem Abu Salem and al-Karara—are operational, severely limiting aid flow.
The WFP has expanded its food distribution points to 26, up from five, but still falls short of the target of 145 distribution points across Gaza.
Humanitarian aid has reached northern Gaza for children and pregnant women, but not in large-scale convoys, and access to key routes like Salah al-Din Street is restricted.
The Rafah crossing remains closed until Hamas hands over the bodies of deceased captives, delaying further access to aid.
Many Palestinians are storing food due to fears of renewed conflict and supply disruptions.
The US 20-point peace plan includes full aid delivery to Gaza, which remains a key component of the ceasefire sustainability.
The WFP emphasizes that opening all crossings is critical to addressing the famine in northern Gaza and saving lives.

namedEntities.name: UN World Food Programme (WFP)
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: A UN agency responsible for delivering food aid to populations in need, including in conflict-affected regions like Gaza.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: The WFP is the central authority monitoring and reporting on food supply levels in Gaza, providing critical data on aid delivery shortfalls and operational challenges.

namedEntities.name: Karem Abu Salem
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: An Israeli-controlled border crossing into Gaza, located in the southern part of the Strip.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: It is one of the only two operational crossings currently allowing food supplies into Gaza, significantly limiting the volume and reach of humanitarian aid.

namedEntities.name: al-Karara (Kissufim in Israel)
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: An Israeli-controlled border crossing into Gaza, located in the central part of the Strip.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: This is the second operational crossing, enabling some food delivery into central Gaza and contributing to the current limited supply volume.

namedEntities.name: Salah al-Din Street
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: A major north-south road in Gaza that serves as a key corridor for humanitarian access.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: The WFP has not been granted access to this route, restricting food distribution to the north of Gaza and worsening the famine risk in northern areas.

namedEntities.name: Rafah border crossing
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: A crossing between Gaza and Egypt, currently closed.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: Its closure delays aid access to northern Gaza and is contingent on Hamas releasing the remains of deceased captives, creating a bottleneck in humanitarian logistics.

namedEntities.name: Hamas
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: A Palestinian political and militant organization responsible for governance in Gaza.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: Hamas has committed to return the bodies of deceased captives, which is a prerequisite for reopening the Rafah crossing and enabling further humanitarian access.

namedEntities.name: Benjamin Netanyahu
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: Israeli Prime Minister, who has publicly stated the Rafah crossing remains closed.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: His position on the Rafah crossing directly influences access to humanitarian aid and reflects ongoing political constraints on aid delivery.

namedEntities.name: Donald Trump
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: Former US President, who brokered the ceasefire and proposed a 20-point peace plan.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: The ceasefire and the 20-point peace plan are central to enabling humanitarian access, with Trump’s role as a mediator highlighting the geopolitical dimensions of the crisis.

namedEntities.name: Qassam Brigades
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: A militant wing of Hamas responsible for enforcing security and political actions in Gaza.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: It announced the handover of two more Israeli captives’ bodies, a key step in fulfilling the terms of the ceasefire agreement and potentially enabling future aid access.

summaryOfNewsArticle: The UN World Food Programme reports that food supplies to Gaza remain critically short, with only 750 metric tonnes of food entering daily—far below the target of 2,000 tonnes—due to only two border crossings being open. Despite a recent increase in distribution points to 26, the WFP stresses that full humanitarian access is blocked by political and military constraints, including the closure of the Rafah crossing and restrictions on access to key routes like Salah al-Din Street. The US-brokered ceasefire, supported by a 20-point plan, is seen as essential for enabling sustained aid and preventing famine, especially in northern Gaza. The situation has led to widespread food hoarding among Palestinians, as they remain anxious about the durability of the ceasefire and future conflict.
title: WFP says food supplies to Gaza below targets, urges more crossings to open
